Authors:
Juan S. Chirivi-Salomon, Silvia Restrepo, Tatiana I
Sanjuan
Title:
Morphological and molecular identification of a new
entomopathogenic species of Lecanicillium from BogotÃ¡, Colombia
Keywords:
Cordycipitaceae, forestry pest, phylogeny, natural
control
Abstract:
Lecanicillium is a paraphyletic genus with a broad range
of hosts, including hemipterans. In this paper we describe the new
species Lecanicillium sabanerum sp. nov., which was found performing a
natural control on females of the scale insect Parthenolecanium sp., a
pest of Ficus soatensis Dugand in BogotÃ¡, Colombia. Twenty-one strains
of entomopathogenic fungi were isolated from 5 different districts from
the capital city. The identification was achieved with a combination of
morphological characters and multilocus (ITS, SSU, LSU, TEF, RPB1, RPB2)
phylogenetic analyses of partial sequences. We used Maximum Likelihood
and Bayesian Inference to conduct phylogenetic analyses. All strains
were grouped together as a unique species with a strong statistical
support and were linked to the Lecanicillium lecanii complex due to its
close relation to Cordyceps confragosa. L. sabanerum differed
morphological and molecularly from four species of the complex, and is
distinguished from Lecanicillium nodulosum by its morphology. This is
the first report of a control natural by an entomopathogenic fungus in a
place with high levels of contamination.
